page.title: 01Summary Kingsbury Episcopi
page.content: The Northern part of this block is flat,being the South West corner of the Somerset Levels.The land around Kingsbury itself is flat.In the southern part of the block the country side is gently undulating with the flat topped cone shaped Burrow Hill a prominent feature.There are two main areas of housing,Kingsbury Episcopi and Stembridge.In Kingsbury there is a church,part of which dates back to 1300.The glove factory in Kingsbury employs about 50 women.This area consists mainly of farmland under grass used mostly for grazing cattle. Many fields are used for silage or hay making.There are many small orchards, usually for cider apples.A small proportion of the land is for rough grazing.Some land is used to grow willow(withies)the slender stems of which are used for basket making.
